byline.contributor: Saw Nang contributed reporting from Mandalay, Myanmar, and Wai Moe from Yangon, Myanmar.

abstract: Rescuers in Kachin State, Myanmar, continue search for jade scavengers buried under landslide that killed at least 120 people; disaster is latest in series underscoring dangerous conditions of extremely profitable but shadowy industry.
lead_paragraph: The landslide, at a mine in Kachin State, highlighted the primitive conditions of an industry that is highly lucrative but notorious for its secrecy.

headline.main: Myanmar Continues Search After Deadly Landslide at Jade Mine
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Continues Search After Fatal Jade Mine Landslide

snippet: The landslide, at a mine in Kachin State, highlighted the primitive conditions of an industry that is highly lucrative but notorious for its secrecy.
